value.title: Why and how to use data protection in Power BI
value.excerpt: Data protection in Power BI can help you to prevent data leakage and have confidence in your data approach. Adam explores the data protection capabilities within Power BI using security labels and cloud app security.  Data Protection documentation overview https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-security-data-protection-overview

value.title: Working with images in Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows you how to work with images in Power BI. He isn't talking about adding a logo into your report. This looks at how you can integrate visuals in your visuals based on your data.  LET'S CONNECT! value.title: Aggregated Table in Power BI with Extra Options   Summarize Function in DAX
value.excerpt: In the previous video, I explained how you can use GROUPBY function in DAX to create an aggregated table. In this video, I'll explain how you can use Summarize function for the same purpose. Summarize function gives you more control on how to create your aggregated table with some extra functions. Let's

value.excerpt: If you used an excel file in a local source (or even OneDrive for Business, but sourced locally), you need to do one extra step to make your query refreshable without the need to the gateway. Here in this video, I‚Äôll explain an easy way to do that change.  Step by step guide is also explained here in

value.title: Change the Data Source TYPE of the Power BI Dynamically using Power Query Parameters
value.excerpt: I have written a blog article and explained how Power Query parameters can be used to change the data source in Power BI. Another useful scenario of it is actually to change even the data source itself. For example, you may have two data sources with exactly the same data structure (columns), but different
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yDOsYewK1LE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IPziqmQgJFw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Compare Period Over Period Breakdown in Power BI Using the Waterfall Chart
value.excerpt: The Waterfall chart is a good visualization to show you changes on value over a sequence, The sequence can be time, or date or workflow steps, etc. There is also an ability in this chart that may not be visible to everyone, and that is the breakdown option of this chart. You can use the chart without

value.title: Create a subset of the table in Power BI and add calculations using SELECTCOLUMNS DAX Function
value.excerpt: Previously I explained the AddColumns function as a function that adds one or more columns to the existing table, In this article and video, I'll explain another similar and useful function with slightly different behavior: SelectColumns, and you will learn how you can use it in Power BI and DAX. value.title: Creating Calendar Table in Power BI using DAX Functions

value.title: Customer Retention in Power BI   DAX Measures
value.excerpt: Customer retention is one of the most common scenarios of data analysis, which is very useful for business.
